attributes.action: Prevent littering - £50 on-the-spot fine for people caught littering our streets
attributes.background: Billions of tons of litter are dumped into the ocean every year. Many people litter our streets with cigarette butts, fast food waste and lots of other things. None of this is good for our environment so we think it should stop.

rejection.details:
We're not sure what action you'd like the Government or Parliament to take. There are already fines for littering in the UK:

http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2005/16/part/3/crossheading/offence-of-dropping-litter

Although the fine imposed is at the discretion of the responsible local council, the minimum fine which can be imposed for littering is already £50:

https://www.gov.uk/guidance/fixed-penalty-notices-issuing-and-enforcement-by-councils
